string-array.name: storyBodyAry
string-array.item: You might invest 35% on bonds because the life decisions you are making require you to remain somewhat conservative with your investments, and bonds have minimum risk. Bonds will give you a set amount of money back, and, with having kids, this can be a way of securing funds for their college education.

You might invest 10% on international Stocks because the life decisions you are making require you to remain somewhat conservative with your investments because these stocks can be a risky investment, as the market can change it what seems like random ways. With a spouse, two kids, and a house you want something more stable to rely on for income, but the potential high payback is worth this small amount.
